name: df-omnd
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6
body: |- wceq(comnd, crab(s0, cmnd, wsbc(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wsbc(s2, cfv(cplusg, cv(s0)), wsbc(s3, cfv(cple, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), ctos), wral(s4, cv(s1), wral(s5, cv(s1), wral(s6, cv(s1), wi(wbr(cv(s4), cv(s3), cv(s5)), wbr(co(cv(s4), cv(s2), cv(s6)), cv(s3), co(cv(s5), cv(s2), cv(s6)))))))))))))
comment: Define class of all right ordered monoids. An ordered monoid is a monoid with a total ordering compatible with its operation. It is possible to use this definition also for left ordered monoids, by applying it to ` ( oppG `` M ) ` . (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 13-Mar-2018.)
